perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, Licensor is the owner of all rights to the trademark “Morgan Stanley” and the “Morgan Stanley” design (collectively, the “Brand”);
WHEREAS, Licensee is a closed-end investment company that has elected to be treated as a business development company under the
Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (together with the rules promulgated thereunder) (the “Licensee Business”);
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, Licensor is the owner of all rights to the trademark “Morgan Stanley” and the “Morgan Stanley” design (collectively, the “Brand”);
WHEREAS, Licensee is a closed-end investment company that has elected to be treated as a business development company under the
Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (together with the rules promulgated thereunder) (the “Licensee Operations”);
perturbation.explanation: The term “Licensee Business” is changed to “Licensee Operations”. This creates confusion as the contract refers to "Licensee Business" in other sections, such as Section 7.1 Indemnity by Licensee. It’s unclear if "Licensee Operations" is the same as "Licensee Business," creating ambiguity in obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 3.1. Quality Control. Licensee’s Permitted Activity shall be in a manner consistent with Licensor’s high standards of and reputation
for quality, and in accordance with good trademark practice wherever any of the same are used. Licensee shall not take any action that could
reasonably be expected to harm the Brand or the goodwill associated therewith. Licensee shall use with the Brand any applicable trademark notices
as may be requested by Licensor or required under applicable laws, regulations, stock exchange and other rules (“Laws”) and reputable industry
practice.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 3.1. Quality Control. Licensee’s Permitted Use shall be in a manner consistent with Licensor’s high standards of and reputation
for quality, and in accordance with good trademark practice wherever any of the same are used. Licensee shall not take any action that could
reasonably be expected to harm the Brand or the goodwill associated therewith. Licensee shall use with the Brand any applicable trademark notices
as may be requested by Licensor or required under applicable laws, regulations, stock exchange and other rules (“Laws”) and reputable industry
practice.
perturbation.explanation: The term “Permitted Activity” is changed to “Permitted Use”. The contract defines “Permitted Activity” in the preamble, and this change introduces a different term for the same concept, creating uncertainty and potential disputes regarding the scope of the license. This change contradicts with the rest of the text.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 4.2. Termination for Convenience. Licensor reserves the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice for any
reason, including if the usage of the Brand is not in compliance with the standards and policies.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 4.2. Termination for Convenience. Licensor reserves the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice for any
reason, including if the utilization of the Brand is not in compliance with the standards and policies.
perturbation.explanation: The term “usage” is changed to “utilization”. While seemingly synonymous, in legal contexts, such changes without clarification can be interpreted as intentional shifts in meaning. This creates ambiguity about the specific actions that constitute a breach warranting termination, potentially leading to disputes over contract interpretation.
